channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report X-2023091114
item.description:
Report X-2023091114

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-06T09:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-24
  • City: EDGERTON
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO THE LEAKING PACKAGE CALL WEARING ALL PPE (INNER GLOVES, OUTER GLOVES, SILVER SHIELDS, SLEEVES, APRON, BOOTS, GOGGLES) AND PER THE DECISION TREE RESPONDER USED PAGE 8, TESTED THE LIQUID AT 0 (RED) AND ADDED BICARBONATE UNTIL TESTED 7. RESPONDER REMOVED THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND ALL SPILL DEBRIS TO THE CAGE AND FOLLOWED THE WASTE DISPOSAL CHART.

item.title: Report X-2023090835
item.description:
Report X-2023090835

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A BOX WAS FOUND LEAKING IN THE UNLOAD. THE BOX HAD SHIPPING PAPERS AND A FLAMMABLE DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX IN A LINED SPILL TUB AND TRANSPORTED IT TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2023090808
item.description:
Report X-2023090808

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-04T06:23:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-18
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A BOX WITH SHIPPING PAPERS AND A FLAMMABLE LIQUID DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL WAS LEAKING FROM A CORNER OF THE BOX IN AN UNLOAD TRAILER. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER FOUND ONE OF THE BOTTLES INSIDE THE BOX LEAKIND FROM CAP. RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX AND ALL OTHER RELATED MATERIAL IN A LINED SPILL TUB AND TRANSPORTED IT TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2023090780
item.description:
Report X-2023090780

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-04T06:23:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-15
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE IN THE UNLOAD WITH FULL PPE ON. USING THE DECISION TREE, THE RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND PLACED ALL MATERIAL IN A LINED SPILL TUB. THE RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE MATERIAL TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON ARIVAL RESPONDER NOTED THE ONE 1 GALLON BOTTLE CAP WAS OFF THE BOTTLE. THE LEAKING BOTTLE LEAKED ON THE OTHER THREE BOTTLES. ALL MATERIAL WAS DISPOSED OF THOUGH DMP.

item.title: Report X-2023100153
item.description:
Report X-2023100153

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-31T15:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-20
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND NOTIFIED QA. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE BOTTLES HAD LOOSE CAPS AND LEAKED OUT SOILING THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.
